name: Flower Class Gift Certificate
description:
For many, the New Year brings a recommitment to trying out something we've always meant to do, or taking the time to learn something new. A gift certificate to a Studio Choo flower class could be just the thing! 

Applicable to any one class for the year of 2014, give something that could very well give back to you or your loved one each and every season.

Upon purchase, we will email you or your recipient a PDF of the certificate. The certificate can be validated simply by emailing us at hello@studiochoo.com with the class preference.

name: Winter Forest
description:
Keep a little of the woods close at hand. One part snowglobe, one part planting - enjoy a wintry microcosm in this 10" glass cylinder. Each terrarium is one of a kind; featuring mini cypress trees, petite plants, moss, stone and a light sprinkle of faux snow.

description:

name: Paperwhite Pedestal
description:
A clutch of paperwhite bulbs planted in a gold mercury glass 
pedestal. Bulbs require minimal care and will show off their fragrant, snow-white blooms for a few weeks. The bulbs may be at varying stages of growth - some showing green start leaves, buds, and blooms. A treat to watch them grow and open! Includes a wintery branch for securing the plants when they get taller.

Available in designs of two or three, the Testing Arrangement features only the best stems we can find, and can be used in the home long after as a statement piece of scientific measure.

name: Birch Hellebore
description:
Delicate, ethereal, unconventional. Forego the usual poinsettia for a Christmas rose, (helleborus niger), and enjoy its white and chartreuse sepals at your entryway or tabletop. Hellebore is potted in a white birch bark pot and paired with a lichen-draped branch wrapped with ribbon.

name: OUR BOOK!
description: THE FLOWER RECIPE BOOK By Alethea Harampolis and Jill Rizzo Hardback, 272 pages ISBN: 9781579655303 (1579655300) Published by Artisan 9.3 x 8.1 x 0.9 inches We are so excited to share our first book with you (release date April 2nd, 2013), THE FLOWER RECIPE BOOK! The arrangements in it run the gamut of styles and techniques: some are wild and some are structured; some are time-intensive and some are astonishingly simple. Ingredient lists specify the type and quantity of blooms needed; clear instructions detail each step; and 400 photos show how to place every stem. Readers will learn how to work with a single variety of flower to great effect, and to create vases overflowing with layered blooms. The book is packed with ideas for unexpected vessels, a flower care primer, and fun design techniques you need to know! If you'd like a gift message just send us a separate email with desired phrase or type in comments section at checkout. Shipped via USPS media mail. Priority shipping upgrade available upon request.

name: Succulent Wreath
description:
This petite but luscious design is a living wreath planted with dozens of succulents. Each wreath features at least 10 varieties, is surrounded by a layer of green moss and finished with a length of ribbon. Set it on a table as a centerpiece or hang up to decorate a wall or door. Measures around 11 inches.

name: Flower Class: 12/22
description:
Winter Fete Centerpiece
Sunday, December 22nd
11am to 2pm
Held at our studio: 339 Baden Ave., South San Francisco, CA 94080 

We'll be sourcing the season's best materials to help you put the finishing touch on your holiday decorating! You'll create a stunning arrangement combining cone laden boughs, fragrant evergreens, beautiful fruits and berries, and an assortment of winter blooms.

In this class we'll demonstrate flower care and the way we put together our arrangements. We'll discuss material selection, design basics, and the importance of air in a composition. Lots of personal instruction and feedback is provided, and you will create a masterpiece of your own to take home.

All materials to create a centerpiece are included (flora, containers and floral snips).  

**Image shown is representative of our style. Actual workshop arrangements will vary. 

Classes will be filled on a first-come, first-served basis. If class does not meet minimum attendance requirement, your payment will be refunded. Classes are non-refundable; please be sure you can attend before you sign up! 

SALES TAX WILL BE REFUNDED AFTER CHECKOUT!
